com.github.jbapple.libfilter

Class BlockFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jbapple.libfilter.BlockFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Comparable<BlockFilter>

    public class BlockFilter
extends Object
implements Comparable<BlockFilter>, Cloneable
    BlockFilter is a block Bloom filter (from Putze et al.'s "Cache-, Hash- and Space-Efficient Bloom Filters") with some twists:
    1. Each block is a split Bloom filter - see Section 2.1 of Broder and Mitzenmacher's "Network Applications of Bloom Filters: A Survey".
    2. The number of bits set during each key addition is constant in order to take advantage of SIMD instructions.

        public static BlockFilter CreateWithBytes(int bytes)
        Create a new filter of a given size.

        The result might be slightly smaller (by up to 31 bytes).

        Parameters:

      • AddHash64

        public void AddHash64(long hash)
        Add a hash value to the filter.

        Do not mix with FindHash32 - a hash value that is present with FindHash64(x) will not be present when calling FindHash32((int)x).

        Do not pass values to this function, only their hashes.

        Hashes must be 64-bits. 32-bit hashes will result in a useless filter where FindHash64 always returns true for any input.

        Parameters:
        hash - the 64-bit hash value of the element you wish to insert

      • FindHash64

        public boolean FindHash64(long hash)
        Add a hash value to the filter.

        Do not mix with AddHash32 - a hash value that is added with AddHash32 will not be present when calling FindHash64.

        Do not pass values to this funciton, only their hashes.

        Hashes must be 64-bits. 32-bit hashes will return incorrect results.

        Parameters:
        hash - the 64-bit hash value of the element you are checking the presence of
